about_the_game:
Sometimes things go wrong and we are led into situations we never imagined before.

After a strange fog invaded the city inexplicable events began.
The student Helena finds herself in the middle of an extremely terrifying situation when she has to face residents with something very wrong when visiting her hometown, Ibaparé, a city in the State of Piauí.
Look for a way out and find out more about the events and why the authorities seem to have no interest in getting involved or dealing with the situation.

Learn about local history dating back to Brazil's pre-colonial and colonial periods and understand that some legacies are too dangerous to exist.

What to expect from the game


Delic will deliver an immersive experience, in which we treat the script and its historical basis with great care, seeking to respect the temporal outline and always maintain the coherent context. Our objective is to faithfully represent the interior of Brazil, especially the interior of Piauí, where the plot takes place. We stick mainly to reality, but we let our creativity flow and often blend into the plot.
The structure of the game initially follows arcade gameplay, however we are increasingly focused on bringing a realistic experience, in the right dose of course. The script is intriguing and deals with extremely current issues, there are many relevant issues that we address. We are confident that our story is not trivial and will especially appeal to those who appreciate depth and immersion.

  • Survivor horror
  • Third person
  • Agile and dynamic gameplay
  • Female protagonist
  • Set in Brazil
  • Full game

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: WINDOWS® 10, 11 (64-BIT Required)
  • Processor: Core i3 9100 or Ryzen 3 2300X
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 6GB or Radeon RX 6400 4GB
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 20 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: With these requirements, it is recommended that the game is played on Low quality settings.
